last_post.content: I received the full peer reviews for my next book and they are so positive and supportive! I’m so grateful to get such thoughtful, generous, and rigorous feedback. Excited to use these to tweak and finalize the manuscript. If you are curious you can read all the draft chapters online. http://www.trevorowens.org/2022/07/open-review-of-the-second-half-of-after-disruption-a-future-for-cultural-memory/

title: Participa a la Fedi - Escola Canòdrom - L'Ateneu - Comunitat Canòdrom

last_post.content:
La #Fedivers no és una alternativa als mitjans socials privatius. És un canvi de paradigma 🔥

A la sessió 1️⃣ de #UniversDescentralitzat vam descobrir amb @titi que Mastodon és només la punta de l’iceberg.

El 2 de febrer seguim amb la sessió 2️⃣ on respondrem tots els dubtes pràctics per endinsar-te a l'#UniversDescentralitzat.

🫧 a quin node vaig?
🫣 hi ha algú aquí?
🤨 què és això de "la local" i "la federada"?
🦘 com salto d'un servidor a l'altre?

title: PancakesCon (@pancakescon@infosec.exchange)

last_post.content:
If you haven't been to my silly virtual conference @pancakescon before, it has a very unusual / insane format. Speakers have to teach a infosec topic that is aimed at junior audiences for half their talk, and then the other half of their talk has to be on a non-cybersecurity hobby, like cooking, music, or astronomy. This will be year 4. https://infosec.exchange/@pancakescon/109784692293736983

Please consider putting a talk in if you are free that day! It is always a lot of fun and our volunteers do a great job.

title: Oil Beach

last_post.content:
"If we switched to renewable energy, the number of ships crossing the ocean would fall almost in half. Because they're just carrying #coal and #oil and gas" -Bill McKibben on Bird.

Port of Long Beach exports a good deal of #petroleum coke & coal that are deemed too dirty to burn in the US. #Shipping fuel is itself filthy (dirtier than diesel).

Map is a screenshot of global marine traffic (red vessels are #tankers), via http://marinetraffic.com

EDIT: for my reply guys: https://press.uchicago.edu/ucp/books/book/chicago/O/bo185167017.html

title: Andy Ngô keeps reporting people on Twitter who post this very real photo of him standing by far-right graffiti

last_post.content:
In October 2021, after I exposed Andy Ngo's connections to a banned far-right terrorist group responsible for arson attacks in Poland, Ngo filed a false DMCA copyright complaint with Twitter to try to suppress my reporting on this story.

Twitter permanently suspended my account due to Ngo's false report, but reversed their decision after a legal challenge by the EFF. Despite Ngo's violation of Twitter's Terms of Service, he was never sanctioned by Twitter. https://www.dailydot.com/debug/andy-ngo-falanga-picture-dmca-twitter/?amp

title: A Right-Wing Brawler Asked a Court to Protect Him From an Antifascist’s Tweets

last_post.content:
Andy Ngo colluded with Proud Boys to endanger me and my son. In September 2021, Ngo tweeted out a video that was recorded illegally by far-right extremists trespassing on my property. The video shows me standing inside my home and it shows the interior of my small apartment — including the area where my son sleeps.

Despite the court granting legal sanctions and a restraining order protecting me and my son from the violent Proud Boy responsible for the video, the video is still up on Ngo's Twitter account in violation of Twitter's own rules — showing a detailed view of the inside of the apartment and naming my city. https://theintercept.com/2021/11/10/proud-boys-antifascist-tweet-chad-loder-court/

title: watershed moment for the BJD: Authors retain their article copyright

last_post.content:
The British Journal of Dermatology just moved from #Wiley to #OUP. As part of the move, it's adding plain language summaries (#PLS) and allowing authors to retain #copyright in their articles.
https://academic.oup.com/bjd/article/188/1/1/6795460

The journal remains #hybrid, not full #openaccess. But note that the key #RightsRetention step was voluntarily adopted by a #society (British Association of Dermatologists) and a #UniversityPress. Kudos to them both.

#nonprofit

title: Government of Flanders to partner with Microsoft to develop data vaults

last_post.content:
Flemish government launched a 'nutsbedrijf' - a public utility company - leveraging Solid (an innovation that allows people to store data used by applications under own control rather than under control of that application) for govt services.

Interesting. But the public utility company was give the name 'Datanuts'. First in the world, probably gaining international traction. And then this name. I mean, someone must have realised. Right?

https://www.belganewsagency.eu/government-of-flanders-to-partner-with-microsoft-to-develop-data-vaults

title: "Publish-or-perish" and ChatGPT: a dangerous mix

last_post.content:
It has become increasingly clear to me that the wide availability of AI-based text generation tools coupled with the "publish-or-perish" incentive of the current scientific publishing system is a dangerous mix, which puts academia on a straight path to becoming a cargo cult. So I wrote an essay about it. Below is a short summary: 1/

https://lookalikes.substack.com/p/publish-or-perish-and-chatgpt-a-dangerous

#scicomm #academia #llm #chatgpt #publishing #science #research #writing

title: Na estreia da série “Edição Comentada”, o historiador Leandro Oliveira destaca a obra de Nino Rota

last_post.content:
«O #SUPER8 volta em nova temporada e com uma novidade para celebrar seus 10 anos no ar pela #CulturaFM: A estreia da série “Edição Comentada”. O maestro, professor e historiador de cultura Leandro Oliveira estará ao lado de Alexandre Ingrevallo destacando os principais compositores de trilhas para #cinema, diretores e fases da sétima arte. Na estreia, o tema é a obra do compositor de trilhas #NinoRota para filmes como “O Poderoso Chefão” e “Amarcord”.»

Para ouvir: https://cultura.uol.com.br/radio/programas/super-8/2023/01/28/109_na-estreia-da-serie-edicao-comentada-o-historiador-leandro-oliveira-destaca-a-obra-de-nino-rota.html #música #trilhasmusicais

title: TishaPaints - Etsy

last_post.content:
The next Snapshots Series update in my Etsy shop will be this Friday, 2/3 at 10AM (EST). I’m not sure how many new ones I’ll list yet, but these four will be there!

Formatted to resemble old-school instant photos, these tiny paintings aren’t meant to be perfect compositions, but represent “in-the-moment” ideas that are formed as I work: Snapshots! Great for gifting, starting an art collection, or just treating yourself!

Oil on Arches paper.

https://www.etsy.com/shop/TishaPaints

title: Battle of the botanic garden: the horticulture war roiling the Isle of Wight

last_post.content: ".. to exploit Ventnor’s unique microclimate as a means of discovering which plant species would be likely to flourish in Britain as the climate continued to warm. He found that he was able to grow plants from far-flung areas with broadly similar climates to that of Ventnor, so that they could survive outdoors through the year. Goodenough gained a reputation as something of a radical, but he commanded the respect of the industry" https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/jan/26/battle-of-the-botanic-garden-the-horticulture-war-roiling-the-isle-of-wight

title: Secret hold restricts DOJ's bid to access phone of Trump ally Rep. Scott Perry

last_post.content:
#DOJInvestigation

We have new info about the DOJ investigation into the Jan. 6 attack.

We know that on August 9th, the feds seized Rep. Scott Perry’s phone.

Perry has been in court trying to prevent the DOJ from accessing the information.

A lower court said prosecutors could have access to his data, but now everything is held up on appeal.

https://www.politico.com/news/2023/01/30/secret-hold-doj-phone-trump-scott-perry-00080233

Most of your questions can be answered here: https://terikanefield.com/all-new-doj-investigation-faqs/

1/

title: 2023 self-paced run of Denial101x starts on February 7

last_post.content:
The 16th iteration of our free online course, "Denial101x - Making Sense of Climate Science Denial", starts on February 7 2023. Since 2015 more than 42,000 students from over 180 countries have registered for our MOOC. The next run will be available for over a year giving you ample time to work through the material at your own pace. Join us to learn about the psychological drivers of #science #denial and how to respond to #climate #misinformation

https://skepticalscience.com/2023-self-paced-run-denial101x-starts-February-7.html

title: Nearly a year on from the supposed Russian exodus, most major companies have yet to withdraw

last_post.content:
A report by the #University of St. #Gallen in #Switzerland, shows that most businesses who promised to leave #Russia in the advent of #sanctions after the #Russian #UkraineRussiaWar have failed to do so.

According to the report of 2405 subsidiaries owned by 1404 #EU and #g7 countries, only 9% had fully complied.

#Europe #divest #RussiaIsATerroristState

https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/31/after-supposed-russian-exodus-most-major-companies-have-yet-to-withdraw.html

title: Was this Brazilian major app bypassing Apple's location privacy on iOS? · Notes

last_post.content:
If you configured your iPhone to never allow an app to access your location, you may have been tracked anyway. Release notes for iOS 16.3 make mention of CVE-2023-23503, which Apple says may allow an app to bypass your privacy settings.

A blogger reports that an app from a Brazilian company iFood was able to track users' location even when they restricted the app's access. I haven't confirmed the report, but the screenshot seems convincing.

I wonder how long this vulnerability was in effect. There may have been massive amounts of location data that was collected without users suspecting a thing.

I'd ask Apple for details, but the company would never answer.

https://notes.ghed.in/posts/2023/ifood-bypassing-ios-privacy-location/

title: School for Poetic Computation

last_post.content:
This spring I'm co-teaching a 10-week online course at SFPC with @aliceyuanzhang and @markanthony.hm called Solidarity Infrastructures, where we will discuss real-world case studies of community infrastructure, and develop projects experimenting with infrastructure as a creative practice. The class aims to challenge the technocapitalist worldview, breaking the dichotomy of "high" and "low" tech, and to explore approaches to solidarity infrastructure in its many forms from mutual aid groups, to peer to peer software, to community mesh networks

applications are open until February 10th at https://sfpc.study/sessions/spring-23 (as well to four other sfpc classes which are also happening this spring, "Narrative Constellations", "The Musical Web", "Teaching and Learning as PRIMITIVE HYPERTEXT", and "Cellular Automata")

title: It is time to make ecocide an international crime

last_post.content:
A proposal has been floated by a group of experts meeting under the auspices of the International Criminal Court in the Hague.

They recommend that we enact a new international crime: ECOCIDE.

The panel defined ecocide as “unlawful or wanton acts committed with knowledge that there is a substantial likelihood of severe and either widespread or long-term damage to the environment being caused by those acts.”

It's not a law yet. But if it were to be adopted, then those scoundrels at Exxon, Shell, Chevron, BP and the rest of the Big Oil criminals should be prosecuted to the fullest extent, with corporate and personal fortunes being confiscated for use in fighting climate change and making reparations.

MORE INFORMATION HERE -- https://www.openglobalrights.org/it-is-time-to-make-ecocide-an-international-crime/

#ClimateCrisis #ClimateJustice #AntiCapitalism
H/T -- @WBOrcutt

title: SF Officials Describe Street Chaos From Cruise, Waymo Robotaxis

last_post.content:
Self-driving automobiles are a solution in search of a problem. People don't want them, but companies like Uber, Amazon, Cruise and Waymo keep pushing them because there's so much money to be made. I hate the way these companies are compromising our safety and the way government regulators aren't pushing back.

Firefighters were battling a major house fire near the intersection of Hayes and Divisadero streets early in the morning of Jan. 22 when a Cruise vehicle with no safety driver started to creep its way into the emergency scene.

Two firefighters stood in front of the car to prevent the vehicle from driving over hoses used to douse the growing inferno, but that didn’t work. As the car continued to inch forward, one firefighter took quick action and smashed the vehicle’s front window, finally bringing the car to a stop. First responders contacted Cruise, who sent workers to move the vehicle out of the way.

https://sfstandard.com/transportation/sf-officials-describe-chaos-from-cruise-waymo-cars-as-they-try-to-slow-their-rollout/

title: http://erreur2000.info

last_post.content:
Quand on lance une newsletter, on ne pense pas toujours à tout. Par exemple, quand est venu le choix du nom, je me disais "tiens, ERREUR 2000, c'est rigolo ça, let's go" sans forcément penser... au SEO, l'erreur 2000 étant l'erreur la plus commune affichée par le lecteur vidéo sur Twitch quand il merdouille.

J'ai donc énormément de gens qui arrivent sur la page http://erreur2000.info via Google en cherchant la cause de cette erreur :blobPikaShock:
